Class hList

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • history.hList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class hList
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    An hList is (in fact) a JDialog. The reason to implement hList as a dialog is for the ease of the integration into a window. In javax.swing, only "Swing Windows" (JDialog, JFrame, JOptionPane, etc) can be displayed as an independent component in native OS. Other JComponents can only be displayed within a Swing Window. Unfortunately, JList does not belong to one of the Swing Windows. Therefore, implementation extending JDialog would make this list lighter weighted than JFrame and also easier to manipulate since JDialog is just like a "pop-up" to main window. For example, you may lock the parent window with dialog but you can't lock a window itself or another window with a frame (lock is, when a pop up is displayed, the situation that you must finish operations in the pop up before going back to the window).

    hList is implemented using JDialog with a JList. The JList takes almost the entire dialog except for the very button where a "Hide" label is placed. Refer to the API's below for further information.
    See Also:

      java.lang.Object[] upDownReverse(java.lang.Object[] obj)
      An extremely simple algorithm for reversing a list.
      Time: lg(n) where n=length of list and lg=log base 2
      Memory: 1 heap allocation, 2 stack allocation, never changed (in place)

      Algorithm: Swap the first and last item in the array until the two pointer intersects.

      • hList

        public hList(java.util.ArrayList<hObject> h,
     History hist,
     int lstID)
        hList constructor. Contains three parameters:
        Parameters:
        h - The hObject list that this hList would be responsible displaying
        hist - The History object that owns this hList
        lstID - The ID of this list for identification on which method should be called when call back (thus this ID is passed to the method)

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(java.util.ArrayList<hObject> h)
        An overloaded method. Accepts an hObject list. Using this method will discard the original hObject list and replace it with the provided one. Use with caution.
        Parameters:
        h - a new list of hObjects assigned to this hList

      • update

        public void update()
        Fill the list with the hobjs field in this object.

      • upDownReverse

        public java.lang.Object[] upDownReverse(java.lang.Object[] obj)
        An extremely simple algorithm for reversing a list.
        Time: lg(n) where n=length of list and lg=log base 2
        Memory: 1 heap allocation, 2 stack allocation, never changed (in place)

        Algorithm: Swap the first and last item in the array until the two pointer intersects.
        Parameters:
        obj - an array to be reversed
        Returns:
        the reversed array

      • display

        public void display()
        Displays the dialog. Call this method instead of the built-in setVisible(boolean). This method contains some more error checking and initialization.

      • setAssociationComponents

        public void setAssociationComponents(java.awt.Frame f,
                            java.awt.Component c)
        Sets the association of this list.
        Parameters:
        f - the frame that contains a component that can be used to call this list
        c - the said component that will call this list
